text: Hi Guys, any idea of its possible to get a blog tag to appear in the default HubSpot search? The tag pages don't seem to be being indexed. My thinking is to implement a bespoke search via the API but our client doens't want to pay to develop something bespoke. I was just wondering if anyone else has any other ideas? Many thanks

Hello!

I'd like to ask if it is possible to enable CORS and / or run a PHP script on a HubSpot website, and / or call an external API with parameters using the HubL language?

Hey there! You would want to use Serverless Functions for what I think you are trying to accomplish <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/features/serverless-functions>.

They allow you to create custom API endpoints that execute server-side JavaScript, which could hit your authenticated APIs.

I have a client that setup a multi-language return and refund policy page here: <https://privacy.peoplekeys.com/es-es/return-and-refund-policy>. The language switcher is working well for the body of the page - but how would I connect the header menu items to also be changed when the language switcher is changed?

i’m working on improving a <https://website.grader.com/> score. after making changes and running the test again, it appears the results are the same. the test results also appear almost instantaneously like the test isn’t running its full assessment. is there a ‘cache’ period on the tool that will show the same results for a period of time?
there is a cache period. I am unsure what the length is, though
curious if you add a random query param if it would break the cache
Tried the query with no luck.
If you run lighthouse in Chrome you will get a pretty similar result which will let you know if what you’ve done made any impact.
The issue website grader is flagging is tap targets. Lighthouse isn't throwing that error, but I'm not sure if it even looks for that.
My buttons and links seem appropriately sized and spaced. :shrug::skin-tone-3:
